newsitem.title: UK: Fuel barges slip in thin trade, Euro cargoes quiet.
newsitem.headline: Fuel barges slip in thin trade, Euro cargoes quiet.

text.p: High sulphur barges in Europe lost ground on Wednesday in very thin activity, while fuel oil cargo prices were steady, traders said.
Efforts to push prices up yesterday failed and left trading rather directionless, dealers said. Bids and offers lost $2 to rest at $82/$84 but only one early deal was seen done, at $83 fob ARA.
"All of a sudden sentiment changed and now everybody is hanging around at lower numbers," said one trader. "The market is quite volatile within a tiny range and I think most people are rather long."
High sulphur cargo sellers were eyeing the Portugese electric company tender for 75,000 tonnes in May, which closes today.
Low sulphur cargo swaps lost $1 and stood at $89/$90 for May, with prompt physical material, though little discussed, around $87/$89 fob.
